skill.name: grafana-dashboards
skill.description: Create and manage production Grafana dashboards for real-time visualization of system and application metrics. Use when building monitoring dashboards, visualizing metrics, or creating operational observability interfaces.
skill.summary: Create and manage production Grafana dashboards for real-time visualization of system and applicatio...

security_audit.summary: No executable code or network activity was found. The content is guidance and dashboard examples only, aligned with the stated purpose.

content.value_statement: Building dashboards without structure leads to noisy and slow insights. This skill provides proven layouts, panel examples, and alert patterns for clear monitoring.
actual_capabilities: Design dashboard layouts using hierarchy, RED, and USE methods
Provide JSON panel examples for stat, graph, table, and heatmap panels
Define query variables and show how to use them in PromQL
Include alert configuration patterns within dashboard JSON
Show provisioning examples for YAML, Terraform, and Ansible
limitations: Does not deploy Grafana or manage data sources
Does not validate PromQL against your metrics
Does not generate full dashboard files from live data
Does not configure notification channels in Grafana

use_cases.title: Service health overview
use_cases.description: Create a consistent API monitoring dashboard with rate, errors, and latency panels.

use_cases.title: Infrastructure visibility
use_cases.description: Design node and namespace dashboards with CPU, memory, and network trends.

use_cases.title: Business KPI tracking
use_cases.description: Build a dashboard that combines request volume and key conversion metrics.

prompt_templates.title: Basic API dashboard
prompt_templates.scenario: Starter monitoring view for a service
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a simple Grafana dashboard layout for an API with request rate, error rate, and P95 latency panels.

prompt_templates.title: Add variables
prompt_templates.prompt: Add Grafana query variables for namespace and service and show how to use them in PromQL.

prompt_templates.title: Alert design
prompt_templates.prompt: Define an alert for error rate above 5 percent with a five minute evaluation window.

prompt_templates.title: Provisioning plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline a provisioning approach using dashboards.yml and Terraform resources for Grafana dashboards.

output_examples.input: Design an API monitoring dashboard for a production service
output: Layout: top row for big number stats, middle for time series, bottom for detailed tables
Panels: request rate, error rate percent, P95 latency, service status table
Variables: namespace and service for filtering across panels
Alert: error rate above 5 percent for five minutes

best_practices: Start with a clear hierarchy from critical metrics to details
Use consistent naming and units across panels
Test dashboards across multiple time ranges
anti_patterns: Mixing unrelated metrics on one panel
Using hardcoded labels instead of variables

faq.question: Is this compatible with Grafana and Prometheus?
faq.answer: Yes. Examples use Grafana dashboard JSON and PromQL, which work with Prometheus data sources.

faq.question: Are there limits on dashboard size?
faq.answer: The skill gives patterns but no hard limits. Grafana performance depends on query load and panel count.

faq.question: Can it integrate with Terraform or Ansible?
faq.answer: Yes. It includes example snippets for Terraform dashboard resources and Ansible copy tasks.

faq.question: Does it access my data or credentials?
faq.answer: No. The skill is static guidance and does not read files or make network calls.

faq.question: What if my PromQL does not match your examples?
faq.answer: Adjust metric names and labels to your environment and validate queries in Grafana Explore.

faq.question: How is this different from Grafana community dashboards?
faq.answer: It focuses on reusable design principles and templates so you can build custom dashboards.
